newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - HRW basis down, corn and soy flat.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - HRW basis down, corn and soy flat.

text.p: U.S. FOB Gulf hard red winter wheat basis bids slipped on Thursday, compensating for strong gains in KCBT futures, while corn and soybean values remained unchanged, exporters said.

Movement was said to be quiet amid lackluster export business. The slow pace was evidenced by USDA's weekly export sales figures which came in at or below trade expectations for wheat, corn and soybeans.
In export business overnight, Taiwan bought one cargo of 54,000 tonnes of U.S. corn and Japan purchased wheat and barley as part of a weekly tender.
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
LH May unq + N nc +23 + N unc
FH June unq + N nc +24 + N unc
LH June unq + N nc +25 + N unc
July unq + N nc +26 + N unc
August unq + N nc +52 + Q unc
Note: N=CBOT July, Q=CBOT August, nc=no comparison
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
LH May +20 + N unc +23 + N unc
June 1-20 +20 + N unc +24 + N unc
June 11-30 +20 + N unc +24 + N unc
July +21 + N unc +24.5 + N unc
FH August unq nc +38 + U unc
LH August unq nc +36 + U nc
Note: N=CBOT July, U=CBOT Sept, nc=no comparison.
